body_html:
Hi @JohnnyY8! The concept behind dropout is to randomly drop some nodes from the hidden layer while training. In the code you've highlighted above, you're applying dropout to the input layer, which is the problem.

For an example of how to apply dropout see this:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/mnist/mnist_with_summaries.py#L109

Hope this helps! FYI we primarily use github issues to track bugs and installation issues; in the future please ask these types of questions on StackOverflow and tag it with the tensorflow tag. Thanks!

body:
Hi @JohnnyY8!  The concept behind dropout is to randomly drop some nodes _from the hidden layer_ while training.  In the code you've highlighted above, you're applying dropout _to the input layer_, which is the problem.

For an example of how to apply dropout see this:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/mnist/mnist_with_summaries.py#L109

Hope this helps!  FYI we primarily use github issues to track bugs and installation issues; in the future please ask these types of questions on StackOverflow and tag it with the `tensorflow` tag.  Thanks!
